solution.text:
In the given figure,we have to find the height H of the plane.
Speed of the plane V = _{l}_km/s.
Time gape T = _{j}_sec.
Firstly we need to find out the horizontal distance of the plane from Akshit
So, Using trigonometry ratio
i.e., tan(A) = \(H\over L\)
i.e., tan(_{k}_) = \(H\over L\)
i.e., \(H\over L\) = _{i}_
i.e., L = \(H\over _{i}_\)
Similarly, horizontal distance of plane after _{j}_ sec
tan(60) = \(H\over L2\)
i.e., \(H\over L2\) = 1.732
i.e., L2 = \(H\over 1.732\)
Now,
we know the speed (V) of plane so we can find out the distance L1 traveled by plane in _{j}_sec as :
L1 = V*_{j}_ km
L1 = _{l}_*_{j}_ km
L1 = _{{l*j}}_ km
From the figure :
L1 = L - L2
i.e., _{{l*j}}_=\(H\over _{i}_\) - \(H\over 1.732\)
i.e., H = \((_{{l*j}}_*_{i}_*1.732)\over (1.732- _{i}_)\)
i.e., H = \(_{{l*j*i*1.732}}_\over _{{1.732-i}}_\)
H = _{{(l*j*i*1.732)/(1.732-i)}}_

content.text: Akshit is sitting under a tree and watching a plane going from east to west.He spotted the plane when he was looking at an angle of _{k}_\(^\circ\) from horizontal. He again spotted the same plane after _{j}_sec at an angle of 60\(^\circ\).Find the height at which plane is flying.Speed of the plane is _{l}_km/sec.
